node.category: What is the way things are?
How do young people feel about video games?
How do young people feel about video games compared to sports?

node.surface: Video games, namely FIFA in my case, can fascinate young people for hours more intensively and emotionally than any sport in the world!

node.category: What could be a consequence from this?

node.surface: It would be fair to make them into an Olympic event.

node.category: Would this be interesting for someone to watch?

node.surface: Perhaps it is less thrilling for a spectator than for the player,

node.category: Are Olympic events interesting to watch?

node.surface: but also for contemporary Olympic events,
I recall curling and 50km cross-country skiing,
you have to be more than a freak
to follow those more properly than only in the roundup of highlights.

node.category: Is there another reason to make video games into an Olympic event?

node.surface: Plus the hurdle to make video games Olympic events is minimal,
as you don't even need doping tests, only a neutral console.

node.category: Is there still another reason to make video games into an Olympic event?

node.surface: And many a video game is physically and particularly mentally more demanding, when I think of the last FIFA tournament's final, than kicking a ball 20 metres.
